metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Second Sunday after Pentecost

locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of Paul's emotional state in 2 Corinthians and a theological reflection on the 'depths' of Psalm 130. Focuses on the nature of the Trinity as self-giving love and the necessity of confession.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher provides historical context (Paul's 'agonized' letter) and liturgical history (BCP changes).

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God and the human condition, with a shift toward blessing/benediction at the conclusion of the first section.
voorbeelden: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness.
This is no dry scholarly doctrine.
The fear of the Lord is founded on his absolute goodness.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort through the assurance of God's love; humility through the recognition of sin.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. The Spirit is mentioned as part of the Trinitarian formula, but the Spirit's current work in the preaching event is not explicitly invoked.

voorbeelden: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
Paul finds himself at the end of his second letter.
There is no human being who can come up with enough credits.
I may leave you today with renewed confidence.
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely quoted from scripture (3rd person) rather than directly issued by the preacher in the name of God (2nd person).

voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Strongest in the liturgical benediction, but weak in the body of the sermon.

constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of Paul's agony or a student of liturgical history rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Present-tense address of God's action now
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Information about grace is provided, but the 'event' of grace is deferred to the liturgical formula at the end.

voorbeelden: With the Lord there is mercy... he shall redeem Israel.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used to include the preacher in the human condition ('we have erred').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used mostly in the 'Imagine' exercises and the final benediction.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Low, mostly used for mental exercises (locutionary) rather than direct address (illocutionary).

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode: talking about Paul, the Corinthians, the Psalmist, or 'the person'.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God is love) -> Directive (Think about your life).
voorbeelden: God’s love spends itself... Reflect on your own life.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Moves from information to introspection without a declarative bridge of grace.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon lacks a clear Declarative/Commissive bridge before the final Directive.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because there is forgiveness... therefore you shall be feared.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Imagine... think... reflect (Directives without a preceding 'I declare to you').

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a high-quality theological essay that describes the mechanics of grace and the history of the Trinity, but it remains 'about' God rather than being an 'act' of God until the very last sentence.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The analysis of Paul's 'crabbed, tumultuous' letter.
sterke_punten.effect: Engages the mind and provides context.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on the BCP removal of 'miserable offenders'.
zwakke_punten.probleem: It is a meta-discussion about liturgy rather than a liturgical act.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The 'event' is largely restricted to the liturgical frame (the benediction) rather than the homiletical body.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher explains the sacrament of the Word but hesitates to perform it.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the object of the speech, rarely the subject acting through the speech.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as an expert witness rather than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: I may leave you today with renewed confidence.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hearer's reflection.
tekstueel_bewijs: The fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon describes the means of grace but doesn't fully function as one.
tekstueel_bewijs: Human love is a glimmer of the full radiance.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 3rd person 'is/was' verbs; too few 2nd person 'promise/declare' verbs.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, God pours out that love for you, to the very last drop.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a present-tense event.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is quoted as a historical text (Psalm 130).
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Directly apply the promise to the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: I promise you on the authority of Christ: He redeems you from all your iniquities.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent on Paul's psychology.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Bridge Paul's agony to the hearer's agony directly.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the one Paul is writing to; this grace is for your 'messed-up' life right now.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'Imagine' exercise feels like a psychological tool rather than a response to grace.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Place the declaration of forgiveness before the call to reflection.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: Theologically rich and intellectually stimulating, but needs to transition from 'talking about' the Trinity to 'delivering' the Trinity to the hearers.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about being a parent; SAT focuses on the preacher's 'commission' to declare God's love.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'Imagine' metaphor; SAT notes it is a Directive that lacks a Performative foundation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is 'locked' in the 3rd person and only released in the final benediction.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The church that was breaking his heart is the one that gets the full Trinitarian blessing.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Good for teaching, but keeps the blessing in the past.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly literary but struggles to break out of the 'constative' shell.
